00024 Clip::Clip (Image image, unsigned int xOrigin, unsigned int yOrigin, unsigned int height, unsigned int width) : image_(image)
00025 {
00026     try
00027     {
00028         // Associate a frame with the image
00029         frame_ = new Pixels(image_);
00030     }
00031     catch (exception& e)
00032     {
00033         delete frame_;
00034         cout << e.what() << endl;
00035     }
00036     
00037     
00038     // Test the clip borders are inside the image
00039     if ( xOrigin >= image_.rows() or xOrigin < 0 )
00040         throw NessieException ("Clip::Clip: The X coordinate of clip's upper leftmost pixel is out of image borders");
00041     else
00042         xOrigin_ = xOrigin;
00043     
00044     if ( yOrigin >= image_.columns() or yOrigin < 0 )
00045         throw NessieException ("Clip::Clip: The Y coordinate of clip's upper leftmost pixel is out of image borders");
00046     else
00047         yOrigin_ = yOrigin;
00048     
00049         
00050     // Test the clip size is consistent with the image size
00051     if ( (xOrigin_ + height) > image_.rows() )
00052         height_ = image_.rows() - xOrigin_;
00053     else
00054         height_ = height;
00055     
00056     if ( (yOrigin_ + width) > image_.columns() )
00057         width_ = image_.columns() - yOrigin_;
00058     else
00059         width_ = width;
00060         
00061     
00062     try
00063     {
00064         // Initializes the pointer to the clip origin
00065         originPixel_ = frame_->get(xOrigin_, yOrigin_, width_, height_);
00066         
00067         // Initializes the image colorspace
00068         switch (image_.type())
00069         {
00070             case GrayscaleType:
00071             {
00072                 colorspace_ = COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE;
00073                 break;
00074             }
00075             case TrueColorType:
00076             {
00077                 colorspace_ = COLORSPACE_RGB;
00078                 break;
00079             }
00080             case BilevelType:
00081             {
00082                 colorspace_ = COLORSPACE_MONOCHROMATIC;
00083                 break;
00084             }
00085             default:
00086             {
00087                 colorspace_ = COLORSPACE_UNDEFINED;
00088                 break;
00089             }
00090         }
00091     }
00092     catch (exception& e)
00093     {
00094         delete frame_;
00095         cout << e.what() << endl;
00096     }
00097 };

00146 void Clip::xOrigin (unsigned int x)
00147 {
00148     if ( x >= image_.rows() or x < 0 )
00149         throw NessieException ("Clip::xOrigin: The X coordinate of clip's upper leftmost pixel is out of image borders");
00150     else
00151         xOrigin_ = x;
00152     
00153     adjustClipSize();
00154     relocateClipOrigin();
00155 };

00279 void Clip::colorspace (Colorspace colorspace)
00280 {
00281     try
00282     {
00283         // Ensure that there is only one reference to underlying image.
00284         // If this is not done, then image pixels will not be modified.
00285         image_.modifyImage();
00286         
00287         // Convert the image colorspace to the new one
00288         switch (colorspace)
00289         {
00290             case COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE:
00291             {
00292                 image_.type( GrayscaleType );
00293                 colorspace_ = COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE;
00294                 break;
00295             }
00296             case COLORSPACE_RGB:
00297             {
00298                 image_.type( TrueColorType );
00299                 colorspace_ = COLORSPACE_RGB;
00300                 break;
00301             }
00302             case COLORSPACE_MONOCHROMATIC:
00303             {
00304                 image_.type( BilevelType );
00305                 colorspace_ = COLORSPACE_MONOCHROMATIC;
00306                 break;
00307             }
00308             default:
00309             {
00310                 // The colorspace remains the same
00311                 break;
00312             }
00313         }
00314         
00315         // Apply changes on the image
00316         frame_->sync();
00317     }
00318     catch (exception& e)
00319     {
00320         cout << e.what() << endl;
00321     }
00322 };

00331 bool Clip::isGrayscale () const
00332 {
00333     if ( colorspace_ == COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE )
00334         return true;
00335     else
00336         return false;

00350     else

00382 Pixel Clip::getPixel (unsigned int x, unsigned int y) const
00383 {
00384     // Check the location is inside the clip borders
00385     if ( (x >= height_) or (x < 0) )
00386         throw NessieException ("Clip::getPixel: The X coordinate is out of image borders");
00387     
00388     if ( (y >= width_) or (y < 0) )
00389         throw NessieException ("Clip::getPixel: The Y coordinate is out of image borders");
00390     
00391     // Get the pixel at desired location
00392     PixelPacket* selectedPixel = originPixel_ + (x * width_) + y;
00393     
00394     // Build a new Pixel object with color information depending on image colorspace
00395     switch (colorspace_)
00396     {
00397         case COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE:
00398         {
00399             ColorGray grayLevel(*selectedPixel);
00400             return Pixel(x, y, grayLevel.shade());
00401             break;
00402         }
00403         case COLORSPACE_RGB:
00404         {
00405             ColorRGB rgbColor(*selectedPixel);
00406             return Pixel(x, y, rgbColor.red(), rgbColor.green(), rgbColor.blue());
00407             break;
00408         }
00409         case COLORSPACE_MONOCHROMATIC:
00410         {
00411             ColorMono isForeground(*selectedPixel);
00412             return Pixel(x, y, isForeground.mono());
00413             break;
00414         }
00415         default:
00416         {
00417             throw NessieException ("Clip::getPixel: The pixel cannot be returned because the image colorspace is undefined");
00418             break;
00419         }
00420     }
00421 };

00436 void Clip::setPixel (unsigned int x, unsigned int y, double grayLevel)
00437 {
00438     if ( colorspace_ not_eq COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE )
00439         return;
00440     
00441     try
00442     {
00443         // Ensure that there is only one reference to underlying image.
00444         // If this is not done, then image pixels will not be modified.
00445         image_.modifyImage();
00446     
00447         // Check the location is inside the clip borders
00448         if ( x >= height_ or x < 0 )
00449             throw NessieException ("Clip::setPixel: The X coordinate is out of image borders");
00450 
00451         if ( y >= width_ or y < 0 )
00452             throw NessieException ("Clip::setPixel: The Y coordinate is out of image borders");
00453 
00454         // Get the pixel at desired location
00455         PixelPacket* selectedPixel = originPixel_ + (x * width_) + y;
00456 
00457         // Assign the desired value to the pixel
00458         *selectedPixel = ColorGray(grayLevel);
00459 
00460         // Apply changes on the image
00461         frame_->sync();
00462     }
00463     catch (exception& e)
00464     {
00465         cout << e.what() << endl;
00466     }
00467 };

00484 void Clip::setPixel (unsigned int x, unsigned int y, double red, double green, double blue)
00485 {
00486     if ( colorspace_ not_eq COLORSPACE_RGB )
00487         return;
00488     
00489     try
00490     {
00491         // Ensure that there is only one reference to underlying image.
00492         // If this is not done, then image pixels will not be modified.
00493         image_.modifyImage();
00494         
00495         // Check the location is inside the clip borders
00496         if ( x >= frame_->rows() or x < 0 )
00497             throw NessieException ("Clip::setPixel: The X coordinate is out of image borders");
00498 
00499         if ( y >= frame_->columns() or y < 0 )
00500             throw NessieException ("Clip::setPixel: The Y coordinate is out of image borders");
00501 
00502         // Get the pixel at desired location
00503         PixelPacket* selectedPixel = originPixel_ + (x * frame_->columns()) + y;
00504 
00505         // Assign the desired value to the pixel
00506         *selectedPixel = ColorRGB(red, green, blue);
00507 
00508         // Apply changes on the image
00509         frame_->sync();
00510     }
00511     catch (exception& e)
00512     {
00513         cout << e.what() << endl;
00514     }
00515 };

00529 void Clip::setPixel (unsigned int x, unsigned int y, bool isForeground)
00530 {
00531     if ( colorspace_ not_eq COLORSPACE_MONOCHROMATIC )
00532         return;
00533     
00534     try
00535     {
00536         // Ensure that there is only one reference to underlying image.
00537         // If this is not done, then image pixels will not be modified.
00538         image_.modifyImage();
00539         
00540         // Check the location is inside the clip borders
00541         if ( x >= frame_->rows() or x < 0 )
00542             throw NessieException ("Clip::setPixel: The X coordinate is out of image borders");
00543 
00544         if ( y >= frame_->columns() or y < 0 )
00545             throw NessieException ("Clip::setPixel: The Y coordinate is out of image borders");
00546 
00547         // Get the pixel at desired location
00548         PixelPacket* selectedPixel = originPixel_ + (x * frame_->columns()) + y;
00549 
00550         // Assign the desired value to the pixel
00551         *selectedPixel = ColorMono(isForeground);
00552 
00553         // Apply changes on the image
00554         frame_->sync();
00555     }
00556     catch (exception& e)
00557     {
00558         cout << e.what() << endl;

00569 void Clip::relocateClipOrigin ()
00570 {
00571     try
00572     {       
00573         // Relocate the pointer to the clip new origin
00574         originPixel_ = frame_->get(xOrigin_, yOrigin_, width_, height_);
00575     }
00576     catch (exception& e)
00577     {
00578         cout << e.what() << endl;
00579     }   
00580 };

00582 
00590 void Clip::adjustClipSize ()
00591 {
00592     if ( (yOrigin_ + width_) > image_.columns() )
00593         width_ = image_.columns() - yOrigin_;
00594     
00595     if ( (xOrigin_ + height_) > image_.rows() )
00596         height_ = image_.rows() - xOrigin_;
00597 };
